2. ¿Cuál de los siguientes no puede describirse razonablemente como datos discretos:

- [ ] Número de visitas a su médico en los últimos 6 meses   
- [x] Gravedad de la enfermedad, por ejemplo, leve, moderada o grave
- [ ] Estado de recaída del cáncer    
- [ ] Mililitros de sangre transfundidos en una operación   



The formula for binomial coefficients is $\dbinom{n}{k}=\dfrac{n!}{k!(n-k)!}$, where $n!$ denotes the factorial of $n$.

So, we have $\dbinom{14}{11}=\dfrac{14!}{11!(14-11)!}=\dfrac{14!}{11!3!}$.

We can simplify this expression by canceling out common factors:
$\dfrac{14!}{11!3!}=\dfrac{14\times 13\times 12\times 11!}{11!\times 3\times 2\times 1}=\dfrac{14\times 13\times 12}{3\times 2\times 1}=\boxed{364}$.

The answer is: 364

## Normal distribution

A normal distribution is a type of probability distribution that has a bell-shaped curve. It is the most common form of probability distribution used in mathematics, statistics, and engineering.

The formula for the sum of a geometric series is $\dfrac{a(1-r^n)}{1-r}$, where $a$ is the first term, $r$ is the common ratio, and $n$ is the number of terms.

In this case, we have $a=1$, $r=0.5$, and $n=6$. Plugging these values into the formula, we get:
$\dfrac{1(1-0.5^6)}{1-0.5}=\dfrac{1(1-0.3921541)}{0.5}=\boxed{40}$.
